item.title: 瑞银集团埃尔莫蒂分析华尔街从气候组织撤退的原因
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）首席执行官塞尔吉奥-埃尔莫蒂（Sergio Ermotti）表示，他正在考虑是否效仿华尔街同行，放弃一个重要的气候融资联盟，因为贷款机构正试图保护自己免受日益加剧的政治压力。【原文：UBS Group AG Chief Executive Officer Sergio Ermotti said he’s looking at whether to follow Wall Street peers in abandoning a key climate-finance alliance, as lenders seek to protect themselves from intensifying political pressure.】

item.title: 美国从全球气候斗争中撤退
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一开始退出具有里程碑意义的《巴黎协定》，在全球应对气候变化的斗争中又一次发起了退却。【原文：President Donald Trump started the US’s withdrawal from the landmark Paris Agreement on Monday, launching another retreat in the global fight against climate change.】

item.title: 绿色和平组织抗议者在达沃斯会议中心高举 "向超级富豪征税 "的标牌
item.description: 绿色和平组织的环保活动人士进入世界经济论坛的会议中心，在达沃斯代表们聚集的大厅上方拉起了横幅。【原文：Greenpeace environmental activists entered the World Economic Forum’s congress center and raised a banner above the lobby area where Davos delegates mingle.】

item.title: 空气污染加剧，曼谷敦促人们在家工作
item.description: 曼谷市政府敦促人们在本周余下的时间里尽可能在家工作，因为空气污染预计会进一步恶化，此前已有十几所学校被迫临时关闭。【原文：The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration urged people to work from home for the rest of the week if they can, with air pollution forecast to worsen after already forcing the temporary closure of more than a dozen schools.】

item.title: 大火之后，洛杉矶的某些地区是否应该永不重建？
item.description:
"有管理的撤退 "这一理念已被应用于受海平面上升和严重洪灾影响的地区，但火灾多发地区可能并不是放弃的最佳选择。【原文：

The idea of “managed retreat” has been applied to areas affected by rising sea levels and severe flooding, but fire-prone regions might not be the best candidates for abandonment.

】

item.title: 印度尼西亚主要岛屿发生山体滑坡和山洪暴发，造成 16 人死亡
item.description: 印尼雅加达（美联社）— 印尼官员周二表示，印尼救援人员在该国主要岛屿爪哇岛上的丘陵村庄找到了至少16具尸体，这些尸体或被山洪冲走，或被埋在成吨的泥土和岩石下。九人失踪。【原文：JAKARTA, Indonesia (AP) — Indonesian rescuers recovered at least 16 bodies that were swept away in flash floods or buried under tons of mud and rocks that hit hilly villages on the country’s main island of Java, officials said Tuesday. Nine people were missing.】

item.title: 投资管理公司为澳大利亚大型电池获得 4.51 亿澳元融资
item.description: 投资管理公司 Quinbrook Infrastructure Partners 完成了一笔 7.22 亿澳元（4.51 亿美元）的新债务融资，用于澳大利亚一个电池储能项目的前两个阶段。【原文：Investment manager Quinbrook Infrastructure Partners closed a AUD$722 million ($451 million) new debt financing for the first two stages of a battery storage project in Australia.】

item.title: 2024 年中国可再生能源装机再创新高
item.description: 中国在 2024 年打破了自己在可再生能源发电装机方面的纪录，这个世界上最大的污染国继续推动能源转型，而美国则不再致力于应对气候变化。【原文：China broke its own record in installing renewable power in 2024, as the world’s top polluter continues to push its energy transition while the US shifts away from fighting climate change.】

item.title: 特朗普开始重塑美国能源，深度关注石油和天然气
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统在周一就职数小时后就启动了对美国能源政策的全面改革，将联邦政府的力量置于化石燃料生产的背后，并从应对气候变化的斗争中后退。【原文：President Donald Trump launched a sweeping overhaul of US energy policy hours after taking office Monday, putting the weight of the federal government behind fossil-fuel production and pulling back from the fight against climate change.】

item.title: 特朗普命令各机构停止拜登气候法的支出
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统已下令联邦机构 "立即暂停"《通货膨胀削减法》（Inflation Reduction Act）的支出，该法案是前总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）的标志性气候法，为清洁能源和其他气候倡议提供了数千亿美元的补贴。【原文：President Donald Trump has ordered federal agencies to “immediately pause” the spending of money from the Inflation Reduction Act, former President Joe Biden’s signature climate law that provided hundreds of billions of dollars in subsidies to clean energy and other climate initiatives.】

item.title: 特朗普解除拜登的液化天然气出口冻结令
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统取消了美国暂停新的液化天然气出口许可证的禁令，兑现了废除拜登政府颁布的这项措施的竞选承诺。【原文：President Donald Trump has lifted a moratorium on new US licenses to export liquefied natural gas, making good on a campaign pledge to rescind the measure enacted by the Biden administration.】

item.title: 特朗普下令美国水域开放石油钻探，推翻拜登的命令
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在上任后的头几个小时就采取了大刀阔斧的行动，释放美国能源发展的活力，废除了实际上阻止了美国大部分沿海水域钻探活动的近海石油和天然气租赁禁令。【原文：US President Donald Trump revoked offshore oil and gas leasing bans that effectively blocked drilling in most US coastal waters as he made sweeping moves his first hours in office to unleash American energy development.】

item.title: 特朗普表示将停止为风电场租赁联邦土地
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统周一就职后发布的一份白宫情况说明称，他将下令联邦政府停止为 "大规模风电场 "租赁美国土地。【原文：President Donald Trump will order the federal government stop leasing US lands for “massive wind farms,” according to a White House fact sheet issued after his inauguration Monday.】

item.title: 特朗普将下令美国退出《巴黎协定》，阻碍气候斗争
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普下令美国退出具有里程碑意义的《巴黎协定》，这是世界上最富有的国家在应对气候变化的斗争中的又一次撤退。【原文：President Donald Trump is ordering the US to withdraw from the landmark Paris Agreement, launching another retreat in the fight against climate change by the world’s wealthiest nation.】

item.title: 英国本周或将遭遇大型冬季风暴，阵风将造成严重破坏
item.description: 据英国气象局预测，本周晚些时候，苏格兰、北爱尔兰和英格兰北部地区将迎来一场冬季风暴，带来破坏性大风和暴雨。【原文：A winter storm packing damaging winds and heavy rain are forecast for Scotland, Northern Ireland and northern parts of England later this week, according to the UK’s Met Office.】

item.title: 阿根廷烘烤大豆和玉米农场降雨减少
item.description: 上周末，阿根廷农田预报将降雨，但大部分地区都没有降雨，使该地区继续遭受干旱之苦。【原文：Rains that were forecast to fall on Argentine farmland over the weekend largely failed to materialize, leaving the region continuing to suffer from dryness.】

item.title: 即将卸任的美国农业部长批评环保局生物燃料报告
item.description: 美国农业部长汤姆-维尔萨克（Tom Vilsack）在其最后一次讲话中批评了拜登政府的一项评估，即美国的主要生物燃料法可能对环境产生了 "适度但负面的 "影响。【原文：US Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack, in one his final acts, criticized a Biden administration assessment that the country’s key biofuel law likely has had a “modest but negative” impact on the environment.】

item.title: 极寒天气和创纪录降雪考验德克萨斯州电网
item.description: 一股寒流席卷美国南部，有可能给新奥尔良和休斯顿带来破纪录的降雪，并造成深度冰冻，危及石油和天然气产量以及电网。【原文：A cold blast gripping the US South threatens to bring record-breaking snowfall to New Orleans and Houston and a deep freeze that endangers oil and natural gas output and electrical grids.】

item.title: 随着大风卷土重来，洛杉矶连续第三周面临极端火灾风险
item.description: 圣安娜飓风的阵风将席卷洛杉矶周围的山脉和山麓，使该地区在经历了两周的毁灭性大火之后再次进入高度警戒状态。【原文：Hurricane-strength gusts from Santa Ana winds will sweep over the mountains and foothills around Los Angeles, putting the region back on high alert after two weeks of devastating fires.】

item.title: 特朗普无法让美国气候排放的时钟倒转
item.description: 今天，唐纳德-特朗普将就任第 47 任美国总统。新任总司令预计将在宣誓就职仪式后数小时内启动国家能源紧急状态。我们今天的时事通讯将探讨这一切对绿色转型意味着什么。我们还将从二十年的数据中寻找总统对美国长期排放趋势的影响力的线索。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读这些报道的全文。更多气候和能源新闻【原文：Today Donald Trump will be inaugurated as the 47th US president. The incoming commander-in-chief is expected to invoke a national energy emergency within hours of the swearing-in ceremony. Our newsletter today looks at what all of this means for the green transition. We will also look through two decades of data for clues on how influential presidents can be on long-term emissions trends in the US. Yo u can read the full version of these stories on Bloomberg.com. For more climate and energy new】

item.title: 特朗普的气候倒退从现在开始。不能抹杀美国的碳减排行动
item.description:
过去二十年的情况表明，气候和能源趋势并不完全受白宫主人的控制。【原文：

The past two decades show that climate and energy trend lines aren’t under the total control of the person in the White House.

】

item.title: 印度 Greenko 创始人拟筹资 8 亿美元收购 Orix 股份
item.description: 印度领先的清洁能源生产商之一 Greenko Energy Holdings 的创始人正在举债购买该公司的股份。【原文：The founders of Greenko Energy Holdings, one of India’s leading clean energy producers, are raising debt to buy a stake in the company.】

item.title: 印尼向全球投资者开放碳市场以提升需求
item.description: 印度尼西亚的国内碳交易所向外国参与者开放交易，因为该国的目标是恢复其作为主要抵消中心的地位，并为当地的气候行动吸引更多投资。【原文：Indonesia’s domestic carbon exchange opened trading to foreign participants as the nation aims to restore its position as a major hub for offsets and attract more investment for local climate action.】

item.title: 澳大利亚铁矿石港口关闭后气旋增强
item.description: 澳大利亚西北部的主要铁矿石出口港口周一仍处于关闭状态，因为气旋加强，带来了狂风和暴雨。【原文：Australia’s major iron ore export ports in northwest Australia remained closed on Monday as a cyclone strengthened, bringing galeforce winds and torrential rain.】

item.title: 澳大利亚计划为绿色铝业提供 12 亿澳元信贷
item.description: 澳大利亚将推出一项新的绿色铝生产信贷，以帮助铝冶炼厂在 2036 年前改用可再生电力，这是澳大利亚中左翼工党政府为促进国内制造业投资而采取的最新举措。【原文：Australia will introduce a new green aluminum production credit to assist aluminum smelters to switch to renewable electricity by 2036, the latest move by the center-left Labor government to bolster investment in domestic manufacturing.】

item.title: 航空业的排放惰性正在困扰新西兰的门户网站
item.description: 新西兰主要航空枢纽奥克兰机场的首席执行官表示，由于偏远地区缺乏低排放燃料，她对航空业在去碳化方面缺乏进展感到担忧。【原文：The chief executive officer of New Zealand’s main aviation hub, Auckland Airport, said she’s worried about the industry’s lack of progress toward decarbonization as remote destinations grapple with a shortage of low-emissions fuel.】

item.title: 东北暴风雪将给纽约带来多达六英寸的积雪
item.description: 一场快速移动的冬季风暴将于周日席卷美国东北部地区，造成出行受阻，寒风凛冽，并将持续到本周工作时间。【原文：A fast-moving winter storm will sweep across the US Northeast on Sunday, snarling travel and creating frigid windchills that linger into the work week.】

item.title: 毛里求斯因水库干涸而限制用水
item.description: 由于水库水位降至临界水平，印度洋岛国毛里求斯将从下周一开始限制用水。【原文：The Indian Ocean island of Mauritius will impose restrictions on water usage from Monday as reservoirs drop to critical levels.】

item.title: 洛杉矶大火揭示加州 210 亿美元公用事业基金的局限性
item.description: 洛杉矶野火焚烧了整个街区，摧毁了数千栋房屋，由此造成的经济损失也在不断增加。现在，投资者越来越担心，如果公司被认定负有责任，州政府为支持公用事业而精心设计的 210 亿美元基金将远远不能满足需要。【原文：Financial losses from the devastating Los Angeles wildfires are mounting after the blazes incinerated entire neighborhoods and destroyed thousands of homes. And now, investors are growing increasingly concerned that a $21 billion state fund crafted to backstop utilities will fall far short of what’s needed if companies are found liable.】

item.title: DIY 充电站在私人住宅中不断涌现
item.description: 电动汽车充电荒漠已不复存在，但今天的通讯显示，插头共享从未像现在这样流行。您还可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享全文。【原文：EV charging deserts are gone, but today’s newsletter shows that plug sharing has never been more popular. You can also read and share the full story on Bloomberg.com.】
